Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • classes.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    I_board

    public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
implements I_board
    This class represent the board where players play to Quarto!
    Author:
    Candelaresi

      • loadBoard

        public void loadBoard(java.lang.String path)
               throws BoardConfigurationException,
                      java.io.IOException
        Loads placed pieces in the board.
        Specified by:
        loadBoard in interface I_board
        Parameters:
        path - contains board file's path.
        Throws:
        BoardConfigurationException - Gets threw when an error occurs into board file.
        java.io.IOException - Gets threw when an error occurs searching or trying to read the board file.

      • saveBoard

        public void saveBoard(java.lang.String path)
               throws java.io.IOException
        It saves board's new configuration in a file
        Specified by:
        saveBoard in interface I_board
        Parameters:
        path - location and name of the file where you want to save the data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - gets threw when an error occurs searching or trying to read the board file.

      • gameSituation

        public int gameSituation()
        It checks if the game is ended or not. There are three possible situations:
        0= the game is ended with a tie
        1= the game has ended and the current player is the winner
        1000= the game hasn't ended
        Specified by:
        gameSituation in interface I_board
        Returns:
        The situation of the game

        Gets board's size: row*column

        Returns:

      • isFree

        public boolean isFree(int position)

        IMPORTANT: Position is given as an integer which stands for an array index to simplify Player class' code.

        Specified by:
        isFree in interface I_board
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • convertIndex

        private void convertIndex(int[] index)
        Converts an Array index into a couple of coordinates for a matrix. Uses an array because it's passed by references.
        Parameters:
        index - it's a vector which contains in the first position the array index and then it insert in the first position the x-index and in the second position the y-index
